# CentOS

CentOS is a popular Linux distribution known for its stability, reliability, and long-term support. It is based on the sources of Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) and aims to provide a free and open-source alternative with binary compatibility. CentOS is suitable for servers, data centers, and enterprise environments where a robust and secure operating system is essential.

Features and Philosophy

  • Stability and Reliability: CentOS is renowned for its stability and reliability, making it a preferred choice for server deployments and critical applications.
  • Binary Compatibility with RHEL: CentOS maintains binary compatibility with RHEL, allowing users to leverage RHEL-compatible software and packages.
  • Long-Term Support (LTS): CentOS follows a long-term support model, providing updates and security patches for an extended period.

Basic Commands

CentOS uses the YUM (Yellowdog Updater, Modified) package management system. Here are some essential commands:

  • sudo yum update: Update the system and installed packages.
  • sudo yum install [package]: Install a new package.
  • sudo yum remove [package]: Remove a package.
  • sudo yum search [keyword]: Search for packages matching a keyword.

    • Pros and Cons

    Pros:

    1. Stability and reliability.
    2. Binary compatibility with RHEL.
    3. Long-term support (LTS).

    Cons:

    1. May have slightly older software versions.
    2. Updates may not be as frequent as some other distributions.

distro.oneLiner: CentOS is a free, enterprise-class Linux distribution derived from the sources of Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL), known for its stability, long-term support, and focus on server environments.

subDistrs.title: Rocky Linux
subDistrs.oneLiner: Rocky Linux is a community-driven, enterprise-grade Linux distribution designed as a downstream, binary-compatible alternative to Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) after the discontinuation of CentOS's traditional releases. It aims to provide a stable and open-source operating system for enterprise environments.

subDistrs.title: AlmaLinux
subDistrs.oneLiner: AlmaLinux is a CentOS alternative, offering a free and stable Linux distribution based on the upstream source code of Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL).
